characters: WE NOW SEE THEM ALL THROUGH THE SCOPE OF A SNIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle of the ocean. Water calm, not a boat in sight. Exc a junky old MOTOR YACHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man on the bridge, piloting the yacht, is GABRIEL BLA 35, athletic, handsome, sharp eyes and a capable demeanor cuts the engines and a plume of black diesel smoke envelo him for a moment and then disappears in the wind. He climbs down the ladder and walks easily along the narr gunnel on the side of the boat, to the broad bow deck. He stands in the center, the boat bobbing gently on the soft waves, and STARES UP AT THE STARS, LOOKING FOR SOMETHING. After a moment, his HEAD TILTS QUICKLY AND SHARPLY, as if struck by something. Then he stares straight ahead, almos trance-like, and WE SMASHCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA GLIDES through a moment FROZEN IN TIME - a THREE DIMENSIONAL SNAPSHOT of the 2008 Mumbai attacks. BODIES a strewn across the floor, MASKED GUNMEN POINT AUTOMATIC WEAPONS, a WOMAN squats in a corner, holding her ears in scream, a window has just shattered, GLASS FROZEN IN AIR. [This “CYBER-RENDERING” will be explained, but to see a visual example of what we’re imagining please CLICK HERE. CAMERA continues to glide past these STILL IMAGES, until. quick glance at a MIRROR and WE SEE MOVEMENT. It's Gabrie the only figure moving through the eerie and surreal scen He's searching for something - someone. As he walks, something else begins to happen. The walls deconstruct an their place we see a DATA STREAM - PHOTOS, NEWSPAPER HEADLINES, TV TALKING HEADS, SURVEILLANCE PHOTOS - all related to the Mumbai attacks. CLOSE ON GABRIEL’S MOUTH as he whispers...

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Amelia, where are you? PULL BACK from his lips and WE’RE...  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel standing on the bow of the boat. GABRIEL'S POV - the 3D ENVIRONMENT of the TAJ MAHAL HOTEL LOBBY surrounds him, semi-translucent. He’s somehow creat a virtual space, out here in the middle of the ocean. Beyond the virtual images, Gabriel also spots an approach VESSEL on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Not yet... I haven’t found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel continues to move through the macabre scene and s the woman he's looking for..

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: No... Amelia, no. He approaches the frozen figure of AMELIA HAYTES, a strik beautiful, Caucasian woman, 30, blue backpack slung over shoulder, an AUTOMATIC RIFLE in her hands, angrily pointi it at a group of HOSTAGES. Standing next to her is anothe GUNMAN, the FLAME from his gun barrel suspended in mid-bu As Gabriel approaches them, WE SEE a rapid DATA STREAM in Gabriel's POV - THE MAN'S NAME, COUNTRY OF ORIGIN - PAKIS AND HIS INTERNATIONAL RAP SHEET. Gabriel turns back to Am and a similar DATA STREAM flashes various images, a CIA I and her name.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How could you... WE HEAR a LOUD VOICE of someone speaking over a PA, IN HI

dialogues.speaker: AMPLIFIED VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Attention, this is the Indian Coast Guard, prepare to be boarded! CLOSE ON Gabriel, as he TURNS toward the VOICE, the entir hotel lobby falling away, revealing that we’re back on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large INDIAN COAST GUARD VESSEL looms just thirty meter off the port bow. Gabriel, very calmly, holds his hands u surrender.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel is being questioned by an Indian Intelligence Off named BADRI ADANI.

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI
dialogues.text: You are in Indian waters, on a rented boat, with no papers, no passport. Gabriel doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What were you doing twenty miles off shore all by yourself? Gabriel glances up at the CAMERA pointed at him from abov Switch to CAMERA POV of Gabriel staring at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the door, a similar CAMERA is aimed down the corridor. CAMERA POV: A FEMALE OFFICER approaches, carrying a CUP O COFFEE. She types in a series of numbers on the ELECTRIC LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks at the door as the final ELECTRONIC BEEP of door combination signals the CLICK of the door opening. T female officer enters and hands Adani his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (Hindi, subtitled) We’re pulling into port now. Adani smiles at her, which Gabriel notices, and she leave Adani takes a sip of his coffee and continues...

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI
dialogues.text: At eighteen hundred hours, we were alerted to a Level One sigint breach on a highly protected military geosync satellite. We sourced the signal to your vessel, yet we didn’t find any communication equipment on board, let alone with the processing power to break through a Helio-encrypted fire wall. Can you explain that?  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 4 10 11

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You know, she doesn’t like the attention you give her.

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That officer. Abhilasha. She's married and you make her uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI
dialogues.text: How do you know her name?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: In fact, she’s afraid of you. Why is that, Badri?

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI
dialogues.text: I haven't told you my first name. Gabriel looks at the SURVEILLANCE CAMERA again. CAMERA’S POV - LOOKING BACK AT GABRIEL. He’s looking back himself, through the camera. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA POV of the HALLWAY. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI
dialogues.text: How do you know who I am? Who are you? Gabriel looks at the door and the LOCK STARTS DIALING. Ad follows Gabriel's gaze to the door as it CLICKS, but does open. He walks to the door and opens it, finding no one outside. He suddenly realizes something...

dialogues.speaker: BADRI ADANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you just do that? He turns back to Gabriel, but the CHAIR IS EMPTY -- SLAM, Adani crashes against the wall and the last thing he sees Gabriel’s feet running up the corridor.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 5 12 13 14 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarms blare as Gabriel runs down another corridor. He reaches a ladder and CLIMBS IT QUICKLY, just as AN INDIAN SAILOR come running toward him. He turns behind him and T MORE are coming from that direction. He runs toward the single sailor. The sailor STRIKES, but Gabriel parries th blow, his other fist snapping like gun hammer into the ma throat. The sailor staggers backward, gasping, as Gabriel heads toward a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The docks of the port pass by on either side as Gabriel emerges onto the deck and RUNS. SAILORS SHOUT behind him. appears in his path with an AUTOMATIC RIFLE. Gabriel drop behind a turret, a barrage of bullets flying past him and ricocheting off the steel of the vessel. The gun continues firing from over Gabriel’s shoulder, wh twenty sailors come at him from two other directions. Amo them is a bleeding and angry Adani, pistol in hand. Gabriel doesn’t hesitate, running in the only direction available to him - the edge of the deck and the water bel Bullets swarm as he dives and splashes into the water of harbour. Adani and the other officers run to the edge of boat and look down into the murky darkness and see NOTHIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cow lazily lumbers along the side of the road, chewing tall grass, as a black SUV zooms by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black SUV leaves a dust trail behind it as it snakes higher and higher up the hillside. It finally barrels up the rise, giving us a VIEW of... A HEAVILY FORTIFIED COMPLEX in the middle of Virginia far country. The compound is comprised of a dozen buildings, large array of radar dishes spread out across a green pasture, all surrounded by MILITARY VEHICLES and SOLDIERS with DOGS circling the perimeter barbed-wire fence. ON SCREEN: U.S. CYBER COMMAND - ANGEL'S BLUFF, VIRGINIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRRORS slide under the vehicle, while a MILITARY SERGEAN flips through paperwork. He takes two IDs from the DRIVER knocks on the back window. It opens, REVEALING RILEY O’NE He checks her face against the ID.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Riley O’Neil? Your driver knows where to take you. There is no wandering inside or outside the facility. No photography, audio recording, cell phone, or portable computing of any kind. You are not to ask any questions or speak to any employees, except for Ms. Strand. Any violations of these rules can result in your immediate arrest. Do you understand everything I’ve just said?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yes, Sergeant. Before she can say anything else, he steps away and signa to someone to raise the gate. The gate in front of the SU swings up and the driver pulls slowly through. On each si of the gate are SOLDIERS, M-16s slung over their shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of Riley’s footsteps and that of her driver ec down the empty hallway, approaching another guard desk. T double doors behind the desk open and a woman steps out. She's LILLIAN STRAND, 50. Lillian has strong, attractive features, piercing eyes, conservative suit, and an all- business demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Pleasure to finally meet you, Ms. Strand. I’ve heard a lot ab...

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: This way, please. The driver stays behind, as Riley follows Lillian back through the double doors and into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a sprawling collection of LAB STATIONS, populated by hundreds of MEN and WOMEN in WHITE COATS.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 7 They pass a section where a woman wearing an EXOSKELETON on a treadmill at 40mph, as TECHNICIANS monitor her.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: I understand you have questions.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I was ordered to go through months of testing and vetting and nobody will even tell me what the job is.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: That's because the position itself is Classified Code Word. Riley expects Lillian to tell her about the job, but Lill just keeps walking. They pass a lab station where a man w EEG sensors on his head sits quietly reading the newspape As he does, the WORDS of the article he’s reading APPEAR BY ONE ON THE MONITOR on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Word Mapping. Ever word has a corresponding brain signal. We’re translating them in real time.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Is that even possible?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What do you know about CyberCom?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I know you’re responsible for cyber security for the government.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: CyberCom’s purview includes the development of genetics, robotics, artificial intelligence and nanotechnology, as well as data mining, DeepNet salvage, cryptanlysis, and protection of the Global Information Grid. And then there’s Clockwork.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Clockwork? Two ARMED SOLDIERS open a set of double doors for them.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down a long corridor toward another set of door

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Last year, 60 Minutes first aired a story about a quadriplegic who could operate a robotic arm with her mind. The microchip attached to her brain was created right here. But Clockwork took it further than we could ever imagine. They reach the doors at the other end of the hallway. A s sign says, “CLOCKWORK.” Two more ARMED GUARDS open the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a walkway surrounding the glass walls of a rou room - THE LAB. A few TECHNICIANS work on equipment surrounding an examination table, on which lies a MAN, th top of his head facing us, so we can’t see him just yet.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Once we started translating the brain’s signals - phase syncrony, neural integration, proteomics - we realized we could facilitate a direct neural interface that could access the entire electromagnetic spectrum - telephone, internet, radio, satellite...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Are you saying you put a computer in a man’s brain?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: I’m saying we created a man who is the first of his kind. An advanced intelligence agent. Now we see the man on the table. It’s Gabriel. His eyes a closed, as a TECHNICIAN works a computer next to him.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We built an agency complex around him - analysts, tack teams, field ops. When a situation rises to a certain level of national security, the Director of National Intelligence brings us in. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gabriel's been active for six months and since then, we’ve enjoyed an 85% success rate. Included in that success is the thwarting of the Super Bowl bomber.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I thought that was CIA?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: You haven't been cleared to think anything different. Lillian opens the door and leads Riley into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian and Riley enter.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What are they doing to him? The technician, AMOS PEMBROKE (29), looks up. that he can answer.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Stuxnet Two eradication.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Stuxnet? The computer virus? He looks at Lillian. She nods again.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Virus? Please. Stuxnet is the world’s first weaponized cyber worm, a digital cruise missile. We took out Iran’s nuke program first, and now North Korea. Boo-yah. (beat) Of course, the only way to plant it in an isolated, bunkerized system, four stories underground, was for Gabriel to carry it himself... (points to Gabriel's head) Which is why we’re making sure none of the code burrowed in.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Is he under anaesthesia? Lillian nods  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 10

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: He wishes. (opens his eyes) Riley. You've changed your hair color.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, have we met? Now we see Riley from GABRIEL'S POV. A facial recognition program draws lines around her face, measuring distance between eyes, etc., as DATA STREAMS, including flashes of TEXT and PHOTOS - are on each side of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: No, but wow.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That nude photo you sent to your boyfriend in college. And they’re yours. Nice.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Riley looks at Lillian, who isn’t amused.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Gotta be careful when you send pictures out there. It’s called Digital Permanence, right Amos?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, he can’t print. By the way, I’m Amos Pembroke, Gabriel’s pri-tech.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Pri-tech?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Primary technician.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Nobody around here uses more syllables than they have to. You’1l fit right in.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Did you just call me stupid?  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 1

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Ten-sixty on your SATs?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I was a bad test taker. Who the hell do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Whoa, I just found a sealed juvenile record?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Gabriel, don’t open that file.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What’s in it? Shoplifting? (hands up in surrender) Fine. But tell me, how does the daughter of a surgeon and a chemist become a Secret Service Agent? In GABRIEL'S POV we FLASH to various images in rapid fire FAMILY PHOTOS, NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS, FACEBOOK PAGES. Final a quick shot of President OBAMA getting into a limo, RILE CLOSING THE LIMO DOOR, an earpiece in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Youngest woman ever assigned to presidential detail. That’s the beginning of a storied career. And now what? Follow around a charming devil with a chip in his brain?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Impressive. Almost every word of that was accurate.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Almost? Which word did I get wrong?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Charming. Amos stifles a laugh. Gabriel shoots him a look. Lillian suddenly very satisfied with her choice in Riley.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Lillian) You should find someone else. Riley walks out. Lillian glares at Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Nice try.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks down the hall. Lillian steps out of the lab, calmly watching her. A moment later, Riley opens the door an ALARM SOUNDS and the ARMED GUARDS appear. Riley turns to Lillian, gestures to the guards to stand down. One of types a code into a wall keypad, the alarm stops. The doo close again, leaving Riley and Lillian in the empty hallw

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: We looked at the best agents from every discipline. Of the top twenty, you’re the only one we brought here.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’m a secret service agent. What could you possibly want me for?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: In that room is the most valuable piece of technology this country’s ever produced. What do I want you for? You're going to protect it for us. Off Riley’s look...

dialogues.speaker: END TEASER
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 13 23 24

dialogues.speaker: ACT ONE
dialogues.text: EXT. DR. WILLIAM CRISPIN’S HOME, CHESAPEAKE BAY - NIGHT 2 A secluded home in the thick woods of the Chesapeake Bay. INT. KITCHEN, DR. WILLIAM CRISPIN’S HOME - NIGHT 24 Standing at the sink, hand washing the dishes, DR. WILLIA CRISPIN, 70, talks out loud. Nobody else is in the room. he insane?

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: Albert, when I was at NASA in ‘69, we sent an astronaut to the moon. A cell phone today has a million times more computer power than we put on that spacecraft. Technology isn’t revolutionary. It’s evolutionary. Oh, that’s good. I like that. Crispin opens the refrigerator, takes out a carton of mil and pours a glass for himself and then pours a bowl for t cat who just landed on the kitchen counter. Then, a SOUND

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sounds like our raccoons are back. Crispin walks to the large window. He can’t see anything outside, only his reflection in the window. He turns off lights, the outdoors now materializing in the relative darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think I’1l keep you inside tonight. The CAT SHRIEKS. Crispin quickly turns on a light, revealing... A MASKED MAN WITH A GUN. The CAT RUNS, knock the glass of milk and a stack of papers to the floor. The glass SHATTERS, shards of glass and a fallen VOICE RECORD scattering under the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please! Take whatever you want! The GUNMAN SPEAKS QUIETLY, WITH A CHINESE ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN
dialogues.text: I think we will.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 14 He says something in CHINESE and a SECOND MASKED MAN appe behind Crispin, holding a gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 26 A gleaming, high tech command center called CDOC (pronoun see-dock), which stands for Cyber Defense Operations Cent Walls of monitors, work stations, lots of PERSONNEL. Riley stands against the wall drinking a cup of coffee. looks up a set of steel stairs, at the large windows of office overlooking CDOC. Lillian’s office. 27 INT. LILLIAN’S OFFICE - SAME Lillian sits behind her desk arguing with Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What did you think was going to happen after India? That’s the third time you went off-book and almost burned Clockwork to a foreign government. And all for intel you already have.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: The Indian DIA files make no mention of Amelia’s death.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: But they did identify her as one of the attackers.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That doesn’t mean she turned. CIA had her deep black for two years. For all we know, she was still dark.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe, maybe not. But thirty-three bodies incinerated in the fire in Mumbai, and she never reported in or showed up on the grid again.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: And that’s evidence? She an 27  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 15

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: If I go to bed at night and there's no snow on the ground and in the morning I’m shoveling, it snowed. (beat) Gabriel, I’m not going to let you bang and burn your own agency in pursuit of this fairy tale you’re clinging to. Whatever became of Amelia, she’s gone. I’m sorry, but it’s time to move on.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: And this secret service agent? That's how we’re moving on?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: That’s how I’m protecting my investment.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What is she, then? Body guard, babysitter, chaperone?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: All of the above. Her primary job is to keep you alive.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That girl?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: That girl's greatest advocate says she personally thwarted the most elaborate assassination attempt on the president since 9/11.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: And who's this advocate?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: The president. Lillian’s phone buzzes. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes, Elizabeth. What do you mean, he’s here now? Is this on the calendar? Well, send him in. (hangs up) Unscheduled visit from the Director of National Intelligence.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 16 The door opens and a SECRETARY lets in DNI OLIVER RUSSELL 50, and DEPUTY DNI TOM LATHAM.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oliver, Tom. What do we have?

dialogues.speaker: DNI OLIVER RUSSELL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for the surprise, but I didn’t want to use a phone. (noticing Gabriel) Gabriel. Good. Glad you’re here. Everybody sit down. Tom?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY DNI TOM LATHAM
dialogues.text: Kidnapping. High value, low profile.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: You're both here, so what kind of value are we talking about? Red?

dialogues.speaker: DNI OLIVER RUSSEL
dialogues.text: I’d say so. And he’s one of yours. Dr. William Crispin. Lillian sits back in her chair. Gabriel exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SURVEILLANCE VIDEO plays. Image is grainy, obscured, sh through the trees of Crispin’s home. Two masked gunman dr Crispin out of the house to a waiting white van. Lillian addresses the room of a DOZEN of her PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Until he resigned last year, Dr. William Crispin was our top neuroscientist and leading member of the Clockwork team. Everyone takes that in. Gabriel, Riley, and Amos. Also he are CHRIS JAMESON, by-the-book investigator, and his part GONZALO “GONZO” SANCHEZ, scrappy, muscular Latino.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Where’s this video from?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: An EPA camera-trap intended to monitor the Chesapeake dwarf bat.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 17

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Has it been scrubbed?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: As we speak. Masks will make it hard for facial rec. Gabriel?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: See? And no audio.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: What about the van’s plates?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: We're trying to dig out a partial.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Did they get his computer?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: FBI swept. No computers found.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: His computer isn’t a concern. I created the encryption protocol. Twenty-forty Bit. Impregnable.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Unless they torture him for his password. Everyone turns to Gabriel. He’s right, of course.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Do we know what’s on that computer?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: If they get in, they could learn about Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: He could be a target already.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Then it’s good we have Riley to protect me. Everyone turns to see the woman he’s referring to. Riley.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 18

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Everybody, meet Riley O'Neil. Introduce yourselves later. (all business) Listen up. This one isn’t like any kidnapping we’ve handled before. The clock always ticks on the victim. This time it ticks on us, too. With that, everyone is on their feet. Riley, though, foll Lillian out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley catches up with Lillian, who doesn’t stop. They continue walking across CDOC and down a long hallway.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Ms. Strand. I hope you find Dr. Crispin, but I put in a call to...

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Your ASAC. Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m not a bodyguard. When the President has an event, I’ve already done ninety percent of my work. I can walk through a hotel lobby blindfolded and know how many steps it is to every exit. I have hundreds of support assets, ambulances, a helicopter on the pad, and two F-22s standing by. We don’t make PTZ stops unless it’s absolutely necessary. You want me to ride with a belligerent protectee, with no assets, and everywhere we go is a potential threat zone? I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: That’s not your problem. Your problem is that you think protecting the president is more important than this.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Because, respectfully, it is more important than this.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 19

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: We got very lucky with Gabriel. When we were looking for a candidate, the criteria wasn’t just to find someone capable. We needed to thread a very rare genetic needle. Let me tell you something about him. When he was a Seal he was alternately shot, cut up, tortured, burned and frozen alive. None of it stopped him. He volunteered for five tours in Iraq and Afghanistan. Five. That’s a hero in there.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’m sure he is. But...

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a technological arms race, unlike anything we’ve seen since the Soviet nukes. Now, if you knew that every nation on earth was trying to steal our nuclear arsenal, would that be important to you?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yes, obviously, but...

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What do you know about Echelon?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It’s a system that develops threat assessments by monitoring electronic communication. Lillian stops and turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Echelon is a hunter. Echelon can find its prey in a jungle so dense that sunlight can’t breach the canopy. Echelon is the most fearsome weapon in human history. (off her look) Riley, Gabriel is Echelon. And protecting him is the most important thing you'll ever do. Lillian lets that sink in. And it does. Lillian puts an unexpected hand on Riley’s shoulder, then keeps walking, leaving her standing alone.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 20 30 INT. GABRIEL’S CAR - DAY 30 Riley drives. Gabriel watches her, but she doesn’t look b

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: So, what’s in that sealed file of yours?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’m surprised you didn’t read it already.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What am I, an animal? (beat) Was it drugs? She looks at him, then back at the road. She’s not playin

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hold up a liquor store? (still no answer) Come on, I thought this was the part where we share and bond.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Seems more like the part where I find out how much of a pain in the ass you are.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Wait a sec... Gabriel’s HEAD TILTS sharply -- something is happening.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What’s happening? Are you okay? Should I pull over?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Hold on...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Gabriel?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: The kidnappers are Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: There’s an audio recording of the kidnapping.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 21 31

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Why didn’t you mention that at the briefing?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Because I didn’t know it until thirty seconds ago. Riley turns the car up the dirty driveway of Crispin’s ho Gonzo and Jameson wave from a front lawn covered with CRI SCENE TAPE and FORENSIC TEAMS. INT. DR. CRISPIN’S HOUSE - SAME 31 The AUDIO RECORDER sits on the table, playing the recordi of the kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (RECORDING)
dialogues.text: Albert, when I was at NASA in ‘69, we sent an astronaut to the moon. A cell phone today has a million times more computer power than we put on that space craft. PULL BACK - Gabriel and Riley, Jameson and Gonzo stand ar the table listening.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Who’s Albert? Gonzo points to the cat’s bowl that says ALBERT on it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (to Gabriel) How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Bluetooth. Once I was in range...

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (RECORDING)
dialogues.text: Technology isn't revolutionary. It's evolutionary. On the recording we hear ALBERT SHRIEK, GLASS SHATTER...

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (RECORDING)
dialogues.text: Please, take whatever you want! WE HEAR the KIDNAPPER SPEAKING IN CHINESE.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 22

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: There it is. Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Mandarin, to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Gabriel, can you translate?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: He’s saying, Bring the house.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Bring the house?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Where did you learn to speak Mandarin?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I didn’t. (points to his head) Software.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You should get an upgrade. It’s not bring the house. Gong-Ding means house, yes. But it also means safe or vault.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Bring the safe. Gonzo and Jameson are impressed, which annoys Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel, Riley and Amos sit with NELSON CRISPIN, 35 years old, next to a large window overlooking the Potomac River

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: What was in the safe? Dad’s computer. We drilled a hole in the back for the wires.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What was on the computer that warranted that?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Nothing compromising. Dad was just paranoid about his memoirs. He’s been dictating them for months. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 23

dialogues.speaker: NELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He said it’s easier to talk to Albert, so I made him a recorder. Nelson takes a deep breath, tries to collect himself.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He is going to be really happy to see you again, Gabriel. Talks about you all the time. That nearly puts Nelson over the edge. Riley looks at Amo her eyes telling him to say something.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: You built the recorder?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wanted it to respond to his voice. Wasn’t hard. I used the Corona chassis, added a few gigs of flash, and hacked some code to make it dump into the computer every night.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: That's why it was sending out the signal that Gabriel picked up. It was trying to log in.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Nelson, is there anything in those memoirs that someone could use to build a chip of their own?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: No way. We know the rules about black intel.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I have a question. If you don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (minding) No, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: If there’s nothing compromising on that computer, and it’s encrypted, why did it need to be in a safe? Gabriel looks at Riley. Nelson looks caught.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ICE CREAM TRUCK sits alone in the park along the river bank, across from the high rise buildings on the other si Inside the ice cream truck is the sniper, his long rifle sticking out through the window. He’s Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Gabriel, Riley, Amos and Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You’re angry at your father.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Why would I be angry?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You’re his lab assistant. He leaves, you’re out, too.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That’s not why he’s angry. He’s angry about me.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Just three weeks ago you sent an email to your dad, “Gabriel is all you talk about. He may be your creation, but he’s not your son.” What happened, Nelson? Did you want the chip in your big brain? Is that what it is?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: I don’t have the mutation.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: And that burns you up, doesn’t it? Tell us about the Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Chinese? What are you... What’s going on here? Amos?  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 25 35 36

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Just tell them the truth, bro.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What was in your father’s safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD VIEW of a CIRCULAR MAZE. CONCENTRIC CIRCLES eman from the center. A shiny MONOLITH floats into the frame. monolith is held by tweezers and we suddenly realize the monolith is a MICROCHIP and the maze is the FINGERPRINT o the end of a finger. The CHIP is placed on the FINGER. The finger belongs to JIN CONG, a handsome Chinese man in dark suit. He stares at the chip, holding it up to the li He turns to Dr. Crispin, framed by two ARMED CHINESE MEN.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: What would your government do to you if they learned you not only made another chip, but you made it even better than the first?

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: It probably doesn’t even work.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: How long after the surgery will you know if it’s been a success?

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: Surgery? I’m not implanting an untested chip in a live human! Cong holds up his phone, on it is VIDEO coming from the sniper VIDEOSCOPE pointed at his son’s head.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: That is a live image from a Chinese- made M99 sniper rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel suddenly turns to the window, HE’S PICKING UP THE SIGNAL from the SNIPER RIFLE’S VIDEOSCOPE. He SEES THE IC CREAM TRUCK OUTSIDE with the SNIPER RIFLE POINTED at them

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Sniper! Get down! Gabriel runs. Riley is on her feet.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 26

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Gabriel, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel runs out of the building, Riley right behind him, are immediately greeted by a hail of gunfire from the fle TRUCK. Riley dives, knocking Gabriel down. He looks up as disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I said wait.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: If you were a man, I'd... Riley comes right up in his face.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Pretend I am! Gabriel stares her down, then breaks away, walking back inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: END ACT ONE
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 a7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jin Cong walks Crispin into a room. When he turns the lig on WE SEE it is an OPERATING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: JIN CONG
dialogues.text: Your surgical team has just landed and will be here shortly. We have spared no expense in outfitting this room with everything you will need.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: Everything I’ll need for what? This isn’t some appendectomy. Getting past the histocompatibility complex was a feat in and of itself, but to coax the brain’s chemical neurotransmitters into generating a completely new biochemical language was tantamount to creating a sixth sense. We rewrote the rules of nature. I implore you to explain to your government...

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: My government? Beijing is too crippled by so-called reformers to do anything this bold. No, doctor, I’m not doing this on behalf of my government. I intend to take back my government from the cowards who denigrate it.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: The fact remains that this simply won't work. We discovered that the candidate must possess a very rare genetic mutation called Athens- 4U7R. To find such a person... Cong nods to one of his men, who opens a door, revealing beautiful, 26-year-old Chinese woman named MEI ZHAO.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: This is Mei Zhao. She possesses the gene mutation, Athens-4U7R. Crispin is stunned. Cong is satisfied.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nelson sits across a table from Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: That chip is based on top secret technology and is vital to national security. I’d like to know who has it now.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Do you even remember me?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: All those years I ran his lab, we didn't have a single conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel, Riley and Amos stand outside the one-way glass, listening to Lillian’s conversation with Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: It can’t be easy.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Your father being kidnapped?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Your father being a genius. In all that time I spent with them, it never occurred to me what it was doing to Nelson. To him, I got to be Pinocchio, while he was only Gepetto’s assistant.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: He passed a lie detector.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: The polygraph is the lowest form of technology. It’s right down there with the self-cleaning toilet. Riley and Gabriel share an amused look.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 29 4l INT. INTERROGATION ROOM, CDOC - SAME 41

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: The chip wasn’t tested, so we don’t know. But, if it is functional, Moore's Law dictates that it will be significantly faster and more robust than the original.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What was William planning on doing with the chip?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: He was going to give it to you.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Just like that? Why?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Loyalty doesn’t always go both ways.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: You think I was disloyal?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: You could have kept him on.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: He’s 70 years old.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Dad's first invention was a garage door opener. He was eleven. This is the guy you keep.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: I don’t make the rules.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: And what about me? I’m not seventy. Do you even know what my contribution was to this program?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: The thing I can’t figure out, Nelson, is why you sold out your country. Was it because I insulted your father by letting him go? Or was it because I insulted you, by not inviting you for tea. Lillian stands and walks out.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian steps out, to find Gabriel, Riley and Amos waitin

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: I don’t feel great about what I just did in there.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You have to push his buttons. You have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: There’s no electronic signpost that he’s lying. No emails, voicemails, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: But he also knows to avoid those traps, right?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: He may be angry at us, but I don’t see him putting his father in danger. Jameson and Gonzo approach.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: We got the partial plate off the video. But, it doesn’t come up on any database.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What about stolen plates?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What’s the partial?

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Maryland, L-4.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (working the chip) A pair of Maryland plates beginning with L-4 were reported stolen one week ago. The car the plates were taken from was a blue, eighty-eight Chevrolet Caprice, parked on the twenty-three hundred block of Castor Road in Rockville.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 31

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: This is a great party trick. How many white Ford vans are ina twenty mile radius?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Twenty-seven.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Ours is a ‘98 Ford E-Series Extended Cargo 2-Door.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That narrows it to two vans. One was towed for unpaid parking tickets six weeks ago and still sits in the impound lot. The other is registered to a business called Bullseye Paintball.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: The enhancement showed paint splatters on one side.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Guess where Bullseye Paintball is? (off their looks) Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s an outdoor paintball arena with various areas set up battle. There’s an old west town, a junkyard, a fake jung etc. There’s also a collection of corrugated aluminum buildings. Riley and Gabriel get out of one car, Gonzo and Jameson o of the other. On the other side of the wooden fences, kid shoot splatters of red and yellow paint at each other.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: What do we do about all the kids?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We have satellite right? Let’s see what’s going on inside these buildings.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Amos says fifteen minutes to get the bird in position.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 32

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: And the tack team is ten minutes out.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: We could look around, not engage.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Guys? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter what they think. We're waiting. Gonzo and Jameson share a look. Gabriel ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I’m going to look around. Gabriel starts walking. Gonzo and Jameson take the cue.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: We'll go this way. Riley, left alone and frustrated, follows Gabriel. As she catches up to him...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You think you’re the first protectee that’s given me trouble?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: The F-35 is the most expensive airplane ever built. The first thing they did was throw it ina war zone. This thing in my head may be valuable, but it’s no good to anyone sitting in the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You're no good to anyone if you’re dead either. We’re going to have to come to some kind of understanding.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: The only thing to understand is that I’m not a machine. You can’t just shut me off.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Too bad for your wife.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 33 44 He turns. She instantly realizes...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God, I’m sorry. I know about your wife, of course. It’s in your file. I forgot...

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You believe what you read? You believe that my wife, a decorated CIA agent, would suddenly fall in love with a blood-loving member of the Lashkar-e-Taiba? Take part ina terrorist attack? Murder innocent civilians?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know your wife.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Don’t ever talk about her in the past tense again. She’s not dead. They reach one of the warehouses. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Gabriel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All lit with black lights, the paint in here is dayglo, a the music, some kind of Chinese rap, is blaring. Splatter glow-in-the-dark paint are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Listen, you don’t have to like me, but this is exactly what Lillian is talking about. And she’s right. Waiting ten minutes won’t change... SPLAT - she gets hit on the arm with a paintball. Glowing yellow splatter covers her shoulder. A kid cackles and ru

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Have you ever been taken, held against your will? I have. And ten minutes can be a lifetime. They arrive at another door. It has a padlock on it. Gabr uses the butt of a FIRE EXTINGUISHER to SMASH the lock.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 34 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Riley enter a dark and junk-filled garage. Al kinds of paint supplies, old paint guns, etc. And in the corner, by the outer door is the WHITE FORD VAN. Jackpot. They approach it. Look in the windows. Gabriel tries the door, but it’s locked. She walks to a tool bench, grabs a SCREW DRIVER and HAMMER. She shoves the screw driver into the door lock, hammers it, turns it hard and POP. It open

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Auto theft? (off her look) The sealed file.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey! SIX CHINESE GANGBANGERS enter. BASEBALL BATS and GUNS. Th voice belongs to a thug we will come to know as HUANG FU.

dialogues.speaker: HUANG FU
dialogues.text: Who said you could come in here?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We're federal agents. One of the gangbangers AIMS at GABRIEL and FIRES, but Ril pushes Gabriel aside and FIRES BACK. They all SCATTER. Gabriel looks at Riley and sees the BLOOD ON HER SHOULDER She falls backward against the car. He pulls her down to relative safety of the floor. A gun in one hand, Riley in other arm, he scans the darkness for the muffled voices o the gangbangers.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You took a bullet for me? What do you think you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: My job. She loses consciousness, slumping over into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: END ACT TWO
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 35 46 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch-black, gunshots, shouts in Chinese. Gabriel stays d low with an UNCONSCIOUS Riley, putting pressure on her shoulder where she was shot. He talks on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: She’s alive, but I can’t tell if... Another SHOT is fired, just misses. Gabriel fires back.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need that bird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian is at the control center. Gabriel is now on speak

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Amos, where's my satellite!

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Two more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: He doesn’t need it in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Moving eighty tons through space. It’s not like ordering a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Gabriel, the tack team is on site, evacuating the civilians. How many shooters?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Seven. Gabriel SHOOTS into the darkness at a moving shadow.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Six. SHOUTS in Chinese are heard. Through the piles of junk Gabriel can see movement. They’re closing in on him.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 36 48 49 50 51 52

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Forty seconds! Riley’s eyes open, just in time to SEE a FIGURE charging them. Her GUN still in her hand, she lifts it up and FIRE HITTING THE MAN IN THE CHEST. Gabriel looks down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Riley’s good arm draped over his shoulder, Gabriel bursts into the now empty indoor range. He tries to get across the large space to the EXIT, but the gangbangers s SHOOTING at them from behind.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Satellite in four, three, two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks out at the darkness and then we’re IN HIS P He sees a three-dimensional space. The room suddenly appe almost translucent.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I’ve got satellite infrared...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You can do that? As he helps her to her feet, INTERCUT with his POV and SE the entire space with INFRARED VISION - A 3D ENVIRONMENT, LIKE A VIDEO GAME, with RED FIGURES hiding behind various obstacles. Gabriel, with Riley’s arm over his shoulder, i able to move them toward the door, while avoiding the BOG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jameson and Gonzo direct the crowd toward the arriving po cars, and flash their badges to the arriving SWAT unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel spots a BOGEY raising a gun. Gabriel FIRES - HITT HIM. They keep moving toward the door. Just as they reach the DOOR BURSTS OPEN and MEN IN TACK SUITS and BAYONET LI move in. Jameson and Gonzo rush to Gabriel and Riley.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Riley emerge into the fading sunlight and flashing lights and sirens.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: We need a medic!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: The Romans used to say it’s bad luck not to give something to the person who saves your life. I think twenty dollars should do it.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You're not giving me twenty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I saved your life, remember?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You want me to give you twenty dollars? Did you miss the part where I used my Terminator Vision to get you out of there? Jameson comes back with the PARAMEDICS.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: No sign of Crispin.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: He’s not here. Paramedics take Riley on the stretcher as Gabriel points one of the Chinese GANGBANGERS in handcuffs - Huang Fu.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That’s the one you want. GABRIEL’S POV - FACIAL RECOGNITION - MUG SHOTS, DATA STRE

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: He’s the boss?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: No. But he’s connected.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: To who?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Chinese MSS.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley is in the bed, shoulder bandaged, hospital gown on. Lillian, Amos, Gabriel and Gonzo are here, too.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Jin Cong? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: That gangbanger’s his cousin.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Jin Cong is a spy?

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: CIA hunted him for about a decade.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: He hasn’t shown up on the grid in five years.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Now he has. Let’s start working it. Gonzo, Jameson, Amos, you head back. It’s time I put in a call to the Chinese. Gonzo and Jameson start to leave. Amos, too.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Riley, I’m glad you’re okay. Before she can respond, he gets yanked away by Gonzo.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Someone has a crush.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Lillian, can you help me get my clothes on? I can’t sleep here.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What’d the doc say?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: That I’m a big girl. Gabriel, give me a ride?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I’1l wait in the hall. When he’s gone...  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 39

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: They brought a clean T-shirt for me. It’s in the cabinet. Lillian realizes she’s not talking Riley out of this. She goes to the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the real on Gabriel's wife?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You want me to take bullets for him, then I need to know where he’s going to be unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: The real is that Amelia Hayes is an enemy of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: If that’s true, why would you violate all established protocol by entrusting the man who loves her with the most powerful intelligence weapon on earth? (realizing...) You don’t believe she’s a traitor, do you? And I bet you don’t even believe she’s dead. Lillian considers her answer carefully.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What I believe is irrelevant. (beat) Let me be very clear with you, Riley. We have spent billions of dollars creating something that every nation on Earth would go to war to possess. I didn’t bring you here to argue with me. I brought you here to keep it safe.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Him. Not it. He’s a human being and she’s his wife. He’s not going to let go of this. Nor should he. Lillian doesn’t have a response. Maybe she agrees.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 40 55 INT. MEI ZHAO’S ROOM, SHENZHEN MICROTECH - NIGHT 55 A makeshift recovery room, built for one patient only. Me Zhao is unconscious, her head wrapped in bandages. A Chin NURSE attends to her, while standing at the foot of the b is a quiet, stoic Jin Cong. Dr. Crispin is brought in by an armed guard.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: We had many heartbreaking failures that often resulted in exactly what we're seeing here. This poor girl could wake up in weeks or months, or never. We are meddling in the building blocks of life. And that mystery is still beyond our reach. Cong produces a BLACK HANDGUN with a PEARL HANDLE, INLAID WITH A DRAGON in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen a Canglong handgun before? Canglong means “black dragon.” This is the finest gun made in the world.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: What are you planning on doing with your Black Dragon gun? Without warning, Cong cracks the gun across Crispin’s forehead, sending him to the floor. He looks up, bleeding

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: Did you sabotage us, doctor?!

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: No! Like I said, she might still wake up! We need to give her time!

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: You will replace this chip with the original chip, the one that works.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: You don’t have that chip.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: I will shortly. Cong walks out, leaving Crispin trembling on the floor.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 41 56 57 58 59 INT. RILEY’S BEDROOM - MORNING 56 Riley wakes up, feels for her bandaged shoulder. Ouch. Sh strains to pull herself up out of bed. INT. LIVING ROOM, RILEY’S HOUSE - MORNING 57 Riley walks down the stairs and STOPS in her tracks. She’ shocked to see that standing in her living room is Gabrie He’s walking slowly, MUMBLING TO HIMSELF.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to? And what are you doing in my house?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Lillian told me to stay and keep an eye on you. He still doesn’t turn to face her. Completely perplexed, walks down the stairs. There’s nobody here but Gabriel. GABRIEL’S POV: Though he can see Riley’s living room arou him, and Riley walking tentatively toward him, what he se more clearly is a FROZEN THREE DIMENSIONAL IMAGE OF...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment frozen in time. We're outside Crispin's home. Tw Chinese gunmen are dragging Crispin toward the van. Two o gunmen carry the safe. Crispin strains to see over the shoulder of his kidnapper. HE'S STARING DESPERATELY AT TH SAFE. Gabriel walks through the frozen scene, stopping at Crispin's face. He follows his gaze back to the SAFE.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (to the frozen Crispin) That's not fear on your face, is it? That's shock. Gabriel looks back at the safe. Then he looks at the dark edges of the hologram his mind has created. DATA STREAMS everywhere. Faces flashing, JING CONG, DR. CRISPIN, HIS S the MICROCHIP being lowered in Gabriel's brain, documents the surveillance video, Lillian, Amos... INT. LIVING ROOM, RILEY’S HOUSE - MORNING 59 Riley watches Gabriel, completely confused.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 42

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell me why you’re wandering around my living room like a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I'm cyber-rendering. HIS POV - she walks right through the apparition of the s

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s something that the chip does that nobody expected. I can create a virtual snapshot of an event in my mind and then walk through it. But it's more than that. It's like a virtual evidence wall. All the intel I have access to, I can see it. The chip processes it like a computer, but my brain metabolizes it, well, like a brain.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You're doing this right now? What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Crispin can’t take his eyes off the safe.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Makes sense. It’s important to him.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: It’s not just that. He can’t imagine how they knew to take it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You said you only had access to available intel. We could barely see his face in the surveillance video, so how are you seeing it now?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: The render is sort of a compilation that’s generated by me.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, you're extrapolating.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Think of it like a dream. Analyze it like a dream.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 43 60 61

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Your brain is saying that the single most important question is who knew what was in that safe? And the only other person who knew is Nelson. That’s why Crispin is so shocked in this cyber-render.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: But, Nelson’s not the only other one who knew, is he? Gabriel turns sharply, as the entire RENDER OF THE KIDNAP FALLS AWAY, immediately replaced by another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stands in Nelson's office at the moment he told everyone to get down when he saw the sniper. Riley and Ne are on the floor. Gabriel walks over to the rendered vers of himself, also ducking below the window frame. Then Gab looks at Amos, who hasn't moved. HE STANDS CALMLY, UNFLINCHING, RIGHT WHERE HE WAS THE WHOLE TIME.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Why aren't you scared? Riley suddenly comes to the same realization...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Amos wrote the encryption code. Twenty-forty bit. Impregnable. The cyber-render FALLS AWAY, leaving only Riley and Gabri

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Call Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’ll call her from the car. EXT. RILEY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 61 They exit and STOP SHORT. Walking up the path, holding a bouquet of flowers is Amos. Gabriel whips out his GUN.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Sorry, Riley.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 44

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Why are you apologizing to me?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: I didn’t intend to involve you. The plan was just to lure Gabriel outside with me at some point.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Drop the flowers and put your hands in the air. I’m taking you in.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: You're not taking me anywhere, Gabriel. I’m the one taking you. From each side of the porch, CHINESE GUNMEN APPEAR, their GUNS pointed at Gabriel and Riley. Amos shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: END ACT THREE
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gray, blustery day. Lillian walks along the riverbank w a man named SHENG-LI WANG, 50, long white trenchcoat over perfectly tailored suit.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Several assets of ours have been taken. As you know, Wang, our two countries have enjoyed a moratorium on this type of behavior.

dialogues.speaker: SHENG-LI WANG
dialogues.text: Perhaps you can tell me which of your assets are missing. And are you sure they haven’t defected?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Where is Jin Cong? She notices that the name got his attention.

dialogues.speaker: SHENG-LI WANG
dialogues.text: Lillian, if your issue is with Jin Cong, your issue is not with us.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SHENG-LI WANG
dialogues.text: He is litimang.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Do you expect me to believe that?

dialogues.speaker: SHENG-LI WANG
dialogues.text: If you find him I’d like to request you turn him over to us.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Of course. We’re friends, right?

dialogues.speaker: SHENG-LI WANG
dialogues.text: You still don’t believe me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Do I believe that Jin Cong, one of your highest ranking officers, has been disavowed?  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 46

dialogues.speaker: SHENG-LI WANG
dialogues.text: Allow me to put it another way. As you might say in your old west, we would accept Cong dead or alive. She barely hides her shock at that statement. He puts out hand to shake, which she takes. SHENG-LI WANG (CONT’D) Lillian, we would make an equitable trade.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: It was wonderful to see you again, Wang. As always. Lillian smiles and walks toward the waiting SUV. As she’s walking she talks.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you get all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jameson and Gonzo sit in the control room. Lillian’s voic speaker. We can see her walking across the Washington Mal from different angles on numerous monitors.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Do you believe him?

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: The dead or alive bit was a good sell.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Where are we with Cong’s cousin?

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Nowhere. And Gabriel’s locator is still dark.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Why would Gabriel shut down his locator?

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: He wouldn’t.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 47

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: It would be nearly impossible without a passcode for anyone to hack a triangulated GIS chip and shut it down. And the only other person who knows the code is...

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: Amos.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Amos had access to Crispin’s computers, so he would have known he was making another chip and that it was in that safe.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: And he sold the information to Cong. I can’t believe it. Amos?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: We'll have time for hand wringing later. Right now we need to focus. Why did they take Gabriel, if they already got away with the new chip?

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: What if new chip doesn’t work?

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: They’d want the only one that does. Lillian climbs into the back seat of a waiting SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in some kind of a large janitorial closet. Gabriel slams against the locked door. No use. He looks back at Riley, at a utility sink, running water on a paper towel.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Do you know how many hours I’ve spent with Amos? Sitting in that lab? All those tests, software updates, diagnostics... you get pretty close to someone. He PUNCHES the door. He turns and sees Riley sit on a met chair. She looks down at the plume of blood on her shirt.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 48

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd better take a look at that. (off her look) Just the wound. Don’t get excited. She winces as he peels the top of her shirt back.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stitches are holding, but it doesn’t look great. He gently takes the wet paper towel from her and begins t clean the wound. It stings, but she takes it. He looks intently at what he’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Did Lillian really tell you to keep an eye on me last night? He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You were supposed to be in the hospital. I couldn’t leave you alone. Just in case. She looks at him. He continues cleaning her wound, studio avoiding her eyes. They’re close, the moment is intimate.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Manslaughter. (off his look) I wasn’t convicted, but everyone agreed to seal the file. It wasn’t hard to convince them. (beat) My parents split when I was ten. My mother got a boyfriend soon after. She wasn’t very discriminating. For the next five years I didn’t do anything to protect us from him. Then one day I did. He’s takes a breath. That wasn’t what he was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You've been protecting people ever since. Maybe she hadn’t thought of that before. Or maybe she had

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You know, I wasn’t just hired to protect you.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 49 65

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I know. You’re supposed to keep me from looking for Amelia.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, hell with that. They both smile, grateful for the moment, a moment burst by... THE DOOR OPENING. Jin Cong and THREE CHINESE GUARDS enter. Gabriel and Riley are both on their feet.

dialogues.speaker: JIN CONG
dialogues.text: So, you're Gabriel. Are you scanning me right now? What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: An asshole. Two of the men grab Gabriel, cuffing his wrists. Riley sh in Chinese, and one of the guards PUNCHES HER ACROSS THE MOUTH, sending her to the floor. Gabriel tries to break f but there’s nothing he can do. Cong commands his men and leaves. They drag Gabriel out next.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riley, whatever happens, stay alive. I’m coming back for you. She watches him disappear, as she’s hoisted into a chair, mouth and shoulder bleeding, hands pulled tight behind he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel is brought in by the guards and Cong. Crispin, dressed for surgery, turns and when he sees Gabriel he si sadly, Gepetto fearing for his Pinocchio.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: Gabriel...

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Doc, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: I'm alive. And you will be, too. Gabriel now notices the straps on the operating table.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: Doctor, if you attempt subversion, you'll be shot and I will dig the chip out of his dead skull myself.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 50. He gives a few orders in Chinese and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: Is Nelson all right?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: He will be. The guards drag Gabriel to the table and STRAP HIM DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: Stop! You don’t have to hurt him!

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (an idea) Do these guys speak English?

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: No. Only Cong. He’1ll be back soon. (picks up syringe) This is Midazolam. It will relax you before the anesthesia. I’m sorry, I don’t see a better option.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley is tied to a chair, her shirt bloody. She doesn’t l great. Amos walks in, carrying a cup of water.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: How are you feeling? I brought you some water.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: I’m the only reason they haven't killed you yet. I told them you could be turned. Riley laughs bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how much money Cong has? I could pretty much buy a Greek Island if I want. Though, that’s not saying much these days. (beat) We don’t have to be enemies, Riley. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 51

dialogues.speaker: AMOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We could be friends. Very rich friends.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I’ll take that water now.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Great. That’s great. He walks over and holds the water up to her mouth. She dr it. She looks at him and smiles a thank you. He smiles. A she SPITS THE BLOODY WATER IN HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jameson and Gonzo sit across the table from Jin Cong’s cousin, who glares back at him from his tattooed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: You're hoping to be deported, right? Think your friends back in China will take care of you?

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: That’s not going to happen, pal. Know why? Because nobody will ever know we have you. You're going to disappear. A KNOCK on the door. Jameson walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian is waiting in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: JAMESON
dialogues.text: He’s a rock.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Our friend, Wang, just had his mother arrested for us in Beijing. Let’s see how much of a rock he is now. She looks in at the hulking frame of Huang Fu.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're all little boys when Mommy’s in trouble.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel is unconscious. Crispin looks to the observation where Cong has just entered. Cong nods to him to begin. Crispin looks down at Gabriel. The Chinese ANESTHESIOLOGI prepares the mask to go over Gabriel’s nose and mouth, wh a NURSE slides a tray of SURGICAL INSTRUMENTS toward Cris The anesthesiologist lowers the mask onto Gabriel’s face. Crispin looks grave as the nurse hands him a SCALPEL. The Gabriel starts CONVULSING. The anesthesiologist freaks, checking his gauges.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: (shouting at the anesthesiologist) What did you give him?!

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: (shouting) What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: He’s in cardiogenic shock! The anesthesiologist is at a loss. Crispin rips the mask of Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gabriel! Gabriel, can you hear me? Help me hold him down! Cong leaves the observation room, immediately appearing i the operating room with them.

dialogues.speaker: CONG
dialogues.text: What’s happening? I demand to know what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t know what they gave him! Gabriel’s legs are kicking wildly.

dialogues.speaker: CRISPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to anesthesiologist) Do you have any Naloxone?! Naloxone?! Do you understand me?!  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 53 70 71 Cong yells to the guards to come help. They each grab a l as Crispin and the nurse hold their weight on his body to stabilize him. The anesthesiologist prepares a syringe. Then... Gabriel opens his eyes, looks right at Crispin.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Now, doc! Crispin backs off of him quickly, as Gabriel grabs the scalpel and jumps up, plunging it into one guard’s throat grabbing the gun from his waist, turning and shooting the other guard. In the melee of screams and gunshots, Cong s out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Crispin run down a hallway, as an ALARM SOUND Gabriel looks up at a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA. GABRIEL'S POV - HE CAN SEE HIMSELF through the CAMERA LEN HE CUTS from CAMERA TO CAMERA THROUGHOUT THE FACILITY. In room, Cong shouts at his MEN to mobilize; in another hall ARMED MEN run by; in the processing plant employees in wh gowns look at each other in fear; in the room with Mei Zh unconscious; finally CUTTING TO: Riley, strapped to her chair, Amos PEERING out their door.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: She’s still there. POV - A SECURITY CAMERA around the corner - ARMED MEN.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In here! He yanks Crispin into a stairwell, as the armed men run b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny CHINESE WOMAN is on a video monitor in a Chinese j talking to camera - to her son, sitting at a table with Lillian, Gonzo and Jameson. The woman is crying as she sp in Chinese. Her son, Huang Fu, is finally cracking.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 54 72 73 74 75

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN
dialogues.text: Huang, the Chinese government is going to make sure your mother spends the rest of her life in prison if you don’t tell me where I can find Jin Cong. Huang’s mother cries as she pleads with him. His body sof and he looks up at Lillian and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian in a helicopter as it lifts off the roof of Cyber A FLEET OF CARS and SUVs, their lights flashing, heads ou beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cong enters as his men point out on one of the monitors, armada of vehicles approaching the facility in the distan including the chopper in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cong enters with his men. Mei Zhao is still unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: CONG, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: We're not leaving without her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm blaring in the background, Amos is at the opene door looking each way down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: I don’t know what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What’s going on is that this is all about to go sideways on you. We HEAR a HELICOPTER starting up somewhere above them.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s your friend, Cong. Sounds like he’s leaving without you. Amos pulls out a GUN and points it at her, his hand is trembling.  INTELLIGENCE_Seitzman_Network Draft 4_012813 55

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Amos?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: If you’re dead, you can’t tell them what I did.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Are you going to kill Gabriel and Crispin, too?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: If they’re not already dead, yes. Out of nowhere a metal chair appears in the air over Amos smashing him across the back of the head. He sinks to the floor, revealing Gabriel and Crispin standing behind him. Gabriel smiles and drops the chair.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: We're even.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Day's not over yet. Gabriel unties her wrists.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Better than dead. They all scramble for the door, but Gabriel stops them.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Wait! GABRIEL’S POV - from a CAMERA IN THE HALLWAY. A GUARD com around the corner. Gabriel goes to the door, turns quickly and FIRES, hittin the guard.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: How did you know he was out there?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
